subject: Failing multiple times in one test

messageBody:
Hi,

I'm writing a test whose purpose is to make sure that a Hashtable contains a
certain set of keys. Basically, the test will make sure that someone filling
out a form on the web provides all the mandatory info.

I was thinking of creating the hash table with every set of keys, then to
remove one key each time to test all the keys and make sure that the
processing fails for each mandatory key. Now, I'm looking for the best way
to show a failure. I could do a fail() and have to run the test multiple
times until I get my processing correctly. This approach is pretty stop and
go. I could also have the test fill an ArrayList with all the parameters
that failed. But that's not quite what I want either. I'd like a way to make
the test fail for every parameter that is missing and consider each of the
iterations as one test. For example, if I want to check for last name, first
name and email address, I'd like to only write one method that checks for
the existence of each of these items. But in my report, I want "Tests run:
3" not "1". How do I approach this?

Thanks,

L

--
Laurent Duperval <mailto:lduperval@...>

La lettre, exsangue et chiffonnée, hors d'haleine mais triomphante, aboutit
